intro: Harfordia, commonly known as the marsh horkstow, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are typically herbaceous, with upright stems and clusters of small, greenish flowers. They often grow in wet or marshy habitats, showcasing adaptations to waterlogged soils. Harfordia species are valued for their ecological roles in stabilizing wetland ecosystems.
